Package org.forgerock.openam.entitlement.rest.model.json

Class JsonPolicy

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.forgerock.openam.entitlement.rest.model.json.JsonPolicy
  • public final class JsonPolicy
extends Object
    A representation of a policy for the entitlements resource. Provides a thin wrapper over an underlying privilege implementation to allow easy marshalling to/from JSON schema. Note that the structure of this class and its sub-components maps directly to the JSON schema via Jackson data binding conventions so care should be taken when making alterations.
    Since:
    12.0.0

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      JsonPolicy()
      Default constructor for Jackson to use.
      JsonPolicy​(Privilege privilege)
      Constructs a JSON wrapper policy using the given privilege object as the underlying policy implementation.

    • Constructor Detail

      • JsonPolicy

        public JsonPolicy​(Privilege privilege)
           throws EntitlementException
        Constructs a JSON wrapper policy using the given privilege object as the underlying policy implementation.
        Parameters:
        privilege - the policy implementation.
        Throws:
        EntitlementException - if the policy is invalid.
        NullPointerException - if the policy is null.

      • JsonPolicy

        public JsonPolicy()
           throws EntitlementException
        Default constructor for Jackson to use. Creates a concrete privilege using Privilege.getNewInstance().
        Throws:
        EntitlementException - if a fresh privilege cannot be created.

      • getEntitlement

        public JsonEntitlementPattern getEntitlement()
        Gets the entitlement used to identify resources and actions for this policy. Note that this object will not be fully constructed, as e.g., the advice and attributes fields are not used in this case. We unwrap the entitlement into individual fields in the policy definition to avoid reusing the term entitlement for something that isn't actually an entitlement.
        Returns:
        the entitlement object.

      • setEntitlement

        public void setEntitlement​(JsonEntitlementPattern jsonEntitlement)
                    throws EntitlementException
        Sets the entitlement pattern used to determine which resources and actions this policy is applicable to.
        Parameters:
        jsonEntitlement - the JSON wrapped entitlement to set on the policy.
        Throws:
        EntitlementException - if the entitlement is invalid, including if its resource list is empty.

      • getCondition

        public EntitlementCondition getCondition()
        Gets the condition used in this policy. May be null. May be a composite condition with an arbitrarily nested logical structure of sub-conditions.
        Returns:
        the condition associated with this policy, if one is defined.

      • setCondition

        public void setCondition​(EntitlementCondition condition)
        Sets the condition to use for this policy.
        Parameters:
        condition - the condition to use. May be null to remove any existing condition.

      • getSubject

        public EntitlementSubject getSubject()
        Gets the subject to match for this policy.
        Returns:
        the subject defined in the policy, or null if not defined.

      • setSubject

        public void setSubject​(EntitlementSubject subject)
                throws EntitlementException
        Sets the subject to use for this policy.
        Parameters:
        subject - the subject.
        Throws:
        EntitlementException - if the subject is invalid.

      • setResourceTypeUuid

        Parameters:

        Retrieves the associated resource type uuid.
        Returns:
        the associated resource type uuid.

      • getResourceAttributes

        public Set<ResourceAttribute> getResourceAttributes()
        Gets the resource attribute providers for this policy. These are used to add additional static or dynamic attributes onto responses from policy decisions.
        Returns:
        the set of resource attribute providers configured for this policy.

      • setResourceAttributes

        public void setResourceAttributes​(Set<ResourceAttribute> attributes)
        Sets the resource attribute providers to use when evaluating this policy.
        Parameters:
        attributes - the attribute providers to use.
